content: The Federal Reserve maintains its commitment to a 2% inflation target over the longer run and considers this level consistent with its mandate of maximum employment and price stability.
SEC regulations require public companies to file annual reports (Form 10-K) and quarterly reports (Form 10-Q) to provide regular updates on their financial position and operations.
The Basel III framework requires banks to maintain a minimum total capital ratio of 8% of risk-weighted assets, with additional buffers for systemically important financial institutions.
